ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: kinda like a mix of behavioral econ and cognitive science classes, good course overall!

Most of the content was relatively new to me despite having taken a few psych courses already- I had never studied behavioral economics type topics or delved into language/concepts so those were very interesting and new.
I learned so much about cognitive psychology and behavioral economics.
Learned about the two modes of thinking and the biases in our thinking, why they occur and how we can try to challenge them to make more rational and unbiased decisions.
I learned about how humans rationalize decisions and take risks. The course also reviewed many experiments that reinforced the ideas and theories learned in lecture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: not much to complain about, course is a well-oiled machine!

Strengths: well-organized, helpful homework, fair assessments
Weaknesses: sometimes lecture slides made it a bit confusing whether one topic was an example/subtopic of another concept or whether it was new, and often these distinctions were important; lots of fact memorization
The strengths were the lectures and discussion sections.

the quizzes were not viewable after submission so we could not use them to study for the exams, and for the exams we could not see how our answers were graded once it was completed and therefore could not learn from our mistakes or dispute any grading. it would be helpful for these canvas quizzes to be viewable after submission/grading. maybe only display the answers after the deadline to prevent cheating but still allow students to study from their responses
I enjoyed the content of the course and felt that the discussion questions and quizzes were a good way to review lecture material.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes!
Yes- it was incredibly informative and engaging, and the assessments and expected workload were reasonable. Be ready to memorize a lot of information though, especially for studies/methods/findings.
Definitely! Its very engaging and you learn a lot.

Definitely, it helps to understand how ourselves and others think as well as how to challenge our inherent biases, plus the professor is great! She is a great lecturer, she's engaging, she's funny and always willing to explain concepts further if there is any confusion
I would recommend the course to other students. The material learned in the course can be applied to the decisions we make every day and is therefore relevant to everyone.

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: This course changed a lot about the way I think about my own mind, decision-making, and how to approach future choices- I honestly think it will affect a lot of everyday decisions I make and the paths I choose in life
I will use what I learned about how humans think to challenge my biases and make more rational choices.
In the future I can use the knowledge I gained from this class to make more rational decisions by realizing the common pitfalls that disrupt decision making.
